0.content_english: The virus is thought to spread mainly from person-to-person
0.content_chinese_simplified: 这种病毒被认为主要通过人与人之间进行传播。

1.content_english: The virus causing coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), is not the same as the coronaviruses that commonly circulate among humans and cause mild illness, like the common cold.
1.content_chinese_simplified: 这种引发2019冠状病毒病的病毒有别于其他通常在人群中传播，并引发轻度症状（比如普通感冒）的冠状病毒。

2.content_english: In COVID-19, ‘CO’ stands for ‘corona,’ ‘VI’ for ‘virus,’ and ‘D’ for disease. Formerly, this disease was referred to as “2019 novel coronavirus” or “2019-nCoV”.
2.content_chinese_simplified: 2019冠状病毒病(COVID-19)的“CO”代表的是“冠状”，“VI”代表的是“病毒”，而“D”代表的是“疾病”。此疾病之前被称为“2019年新型冠状病毒”或“2019-nCOV”。

3.content_english: This virus was first detected in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China. The first infections were linked to a live animal market, but the virus is now spreading from person-to-person.
3.content_chinese_simplified: 这个病毒在中国湖北省武汉市被首次检测到。首例感染与一个生鲜市场有关，但是现在主要靠人传人进行传播。

4.content_english: The official name for the virus that causes COVID-19 is SARS-CoV-2
4.content_chinese_simplified: 2019冠状病毒病（COVID-19）的致病病毒官方名称叫做SARS_CoV-2。

5.content_english: Children are at high risk of disease
5.answer_english: FALSE. While children can be infected, they tend to develop mild symptoms.
5.content_chinese_simplified: 儿童感染2019冠状病毒病的风险较高。
5.answer_chinese_simplified: 错。 尽管儿童也会被感染，但是他们的症状不会太严重。

6.content_english: Common symptoms of COVID-19 include fever, dry cough, fatigue, or shortness of breath
6.content_chinese_simplified: 2019冠状病毒病的常见症状包括发热，干咳，乏力或者呼吸不畅。

7.content_english: Social distancing (avoiding large crowds) is the best way to prevent spread.
7.content_chinese_simplified: 保持社交距离（避免人群聚集）是防止传播的最好方法。

8.content_english: Hanging out in the park in a large group is fine because it is outside.
8.answer_english: FALSE. Try to stay 6 feet away from other individuals as much as possible.
8.content_chinese_simplified: 一大群人在公园中聚会是没问题的，因为这是在开阔的空间。
8.answer_chinese_simplified: 错。人与人之间应尽量保持6 英尺远。

9.content_english: If I experience any symptoms of COVID-19, I should immediately go to the Emergency Room.
9.answer_english: FALSE. Unless it is a life-threatening emergency, call your doctor first before going to a hospital.
9.content_chinese_simplified: 如果我出现任何2019冠状病毒病的症状，我应该立即去急诊室。
9.answer_chinese_simplified: 错。除非您的症状有可能危及生命，请在去医院之前先打电话咨询您的医生。

10.content_english: Younger people between 20-60 years old can't get the virus.
10.answer_english: FALSE. Young people can get the virus and spread it to others. Some young people develop sever symptoms that require hospitalization.
10.content_chinese_simplified: 20岁到60岁之间的人不会得2019冠状病毒病。
10.answer_chinese_simplified: 错。 年轻人也会得这个病，并把它传给他人。有些得病的年轻人也会发展成重症，需要住院治疗。

11.content_english: The virus causing coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), is not the same as the coronaviruses that commonly circulate among humans and cause mild illness, like the common cold.
11.content_chinese_simplified: 这种引发2019冠状病毒病的病毒有别于其他通常在人群中传播，并引发轻度症状（比如普通感冒）的冠状病毒。

12.content_english: In COVID-19, ‘CO’ stands for ‘corona,’ ‘VI’ for ‘virus,’ and ‘D’ for disease. Formerly, this disease was referred to as “2019 novel coronavirus” or “2019-nCoV”.
12.content_chinese_simplified: COVID-19的“CO”代表的是“冠状”，“VI”代表的是“病毒”，而“D”代表的是“疾病”。此疾病之前被称为“2019年新型冠状病毒”或“2019-nCOV”。

13.content_english: This virus was first detected in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China. The first infections were linked to a live animal market, but the virus is now spreading from person-to-person.
13.content_chinese_simplified: 这个病毒在中国湖北省武汉市被首次检测到。首例感染与一个生鲜市场有关，但是现在主要靠人传人进行传播。

14.content_english: The official name for the virus that causes COVID-19 is SARS-CoV-2
14.content_chinese_simplified: 2019冠状病毒病（COVID-19）的致病病毒官方名称叫做SARS_CoV-2。

15.content_english: A virus is a tiny packet of genetic information contained in a protein envelope. Viruses enter the body, invade host cells and force them to make more virus copies. This can cause the infected cells to die and infect other cells, which is what makes people sick.
15.content_chinese_simplified: 病毒是包含在蛋白质包膜中的一小包基因信息。病毒进入人体，侵入宿主细胞，并迫使它们复制更多的病毒。这会导致被感染的细胞死亡并感染其他细胞，使人们生病。

16.content_english: The coronavirus is roughly 120nm in diameter. For reference, you could fit about 2,500 virus particles end to end on a single grain of salt!
16.content_chinese_simplified: 冠状病毒的直径约为120纳米。若您把大约2500个病毒粒子端对端地排在一起，它们的总长度也不过等于一粒盐的直径！

17.content_english: Viruses are not living organisms. Unlike bacteria, viruses are unable to replicate and live on their own. They must infect a host to survive and reproduce.
17.content_chinese_simplified: 病毒不是生物。病毒与细菌不同，无法自我繁殖和生存。它们必须感染宿主才能生存和繁殖。

18.content_english: In order to fight a virus, your body’s immune system must be able to recognize it and destroy it. Viruses cannot be “killed” with medication because they are not alive.
18.content_chinese_simplified: 为了对抗病毒，您身体的免疫系统须得先认识病毒，然后再消灭它。病毒不是生物，所以不能被药物“杀死”。

19.content_english: The official name of the virus is SARS-CoV-2 (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2). The original SARS-CoV emerged in 2002 and was responsible for the SARS outbreak. While the death rate of SARS was higher than COVID-19, it infected and killed far fewer people. There have been no cases of SARS since 2003.
19.content_chinese_simplified: 此病毒的官方名称是SARS-CoV-2（严重急性呼吸综合征冠状病毒2）。SARS冠状病毒最初出现在2002年，是SARS爆发的原因。虽然SARS的死亡率高于COVID-19，但感染与死亡人数却少很多。自2003年以来，就没有过SARS病例。

20.content_english: While it is believed that SARS-CoV-2 originated in a wild animal market in Wuhan, the risk of catching a new coronavirus from animals remains very low. However, care should always be taken when handling raw meat, milk, or animal organs. Always ensure foods are properly cooked before consuming. (WHO)
20.content_chinese_simplified: 虽然人们目前认为SARS-CoV-2起源于武汉的一个野生动物市场，但从动物身上感染新型冠状病毒的风险很低。无论如何，我们在处理生肉、牛奶或动物器官时应当小心，必定要在食用前确保食物煮熟。（世界卫生组织）

21.content_english: There is only one documented case of a dog being infected with SARS-CoV-2, so there is little evidence that pets can spread the disease. However, you should still wash your hands after handling pets, especially after walking your dog. Dogs could still contact contaminated surfaces and carry the virus externally. (WHO)
21.content_chinese_simplified: 目前世界上只有一例确诊感染了SARS-CoV-2的狗，所以我们没有证据能够证明宠物也能够传播这种病毒。但是您还是应该在与宠物接触后洗手，尤其是遛狗之后。狗依然可以接触被污染的表面并携带病毒。（世界卫生组织）

22.content_english: It is safe to receive packages from areas where COVID-19 has been reported. The likelihood of an infected person contaminating commercial goods is low and the risk of catching the virus that causes COVID-19 from a package that has been moved, travelled, and exposed to different conditions and temperature is also low. (WHO)
22.content_chinese_simplified: 我们能够放心地从有2019冠状病毒病病例的地区接收包裹。包裹带有病毒的可能性很低。在运输过程中，包裹因暴露在不同环境和温度条件而感染引发2019冠状病毒病的风险也很低。（世界卫生组织）

23.content_english: The amount of time the virus can survive on surfaces depends on the material and the environmental conditions. Studies have shown that the virus is detectable for up to two weeks on hard surfaces, but survives for less time on porous surfaces like clothing and cardboard. (WHO)
23.content_chinese_simplified: 病毒在物体表面存活的时间取决于其材质以及环境条件。研究表明，这种病毒可以在坚硬表面上存活达两周，但它在衣服和纸板等多孔表面上存活的时间较短。（世界卫生组织）

24.content_english: The only way to get COVID-19 is for an infected person to sneeze on you. The virus can't survive outside the body.
24.answer_english: FALSE: The virus can survive for a few hours on porous surfaces and much longer on hard or metallic surfaces. Contact with a contaminated surface is a common way to catch COVID-19.
24.content_chinese_simplified: 感染2019冠状病毒病的唯一方法是让受感染者对着你打喷嚏。病毒不能在体外存活。
24.answer_chinese_simplified: 错。病毒可以在多孔表面存活几个小时，在坚硬或金属表面上存活更长时间。接触污染表面是感染2019冠状病毒病的常见方式。

25.content_english: Taking antibiotics will not prevent you from getting COVID-19, which is caused by a virus. Antibiotics kill bacteria and should only be used when directed by a physician. Antibiotics can do more harm than good if used improperly. (WHO)
25.content_chinese_simplified: 服用抗生素并不能防止您感染2019冠状病毒病。此疾病是由病毒引起的，而抗生素杀死的只是细菌。抗生素只有在医生的指导下才能使用。抗生素若使用不当，会对身体带来伤害。（世界卫生组织）

26.content_english: Individuals over age 65, and all people with chronic lung disease, moderate or severe asthma, serious heart conditions, diabetes, chronic kidney disease, liver disease and people who are immunocompromised are at higher risk for developingg severe COVID-19. However, young people can still get it. (WHO)
26.content_chinese_simplified: 65岁以上及所有患有慢性肺病，中度或重度哮喘，严重心脏病，糖尿病，慢性肾脏疾病，肝病，和免疫功能低下的人感染2019冠状病毒病并发展为重症的可能性更高。但是年轻人同样存在感染风险。（世界卫生组织）

27.content_english: Young people can go outside and socialize because there is no risk in contracting COVID-19
27.answer_english: FALSE: Younger people can still get COVID-19. They are less likely to die from the virus, but they can still catch it and pass on to higher risk people.
27.content_chinese_simplified: 年轻人可以外出参加社交活动，因为年轻人不存在感染2019冠状病毒病的风险。
27.answer_chinese_simplified: 错：年轻人仍有可能感染2019冠状病毒病。虽然年轻患者的死亡率较低，但是他们仍有可能被感染并将病毒传播给高风险人群。

28.content_english: The most common symptoms of COVID-19 are fever, tiredness, and dry cough. Some patients may have aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat or diarrhea. These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually. Some people become infected but don’t develop any symptoms and don't feel unwell. Most people (about 80%) recover from the disease without needing special treatment. (WHO)
28.content_chinese_simplified: 2019冠状病毒病最常见的症状是发热、乏力和干咳。有些患者可能伴有疼痛、鼻塞、流涕、咽痛或腹泻等症状。这些症状往往较为轻微，且逐渐显现。有些感染者并无任何症状，也无不适感。大多数感染者（约80%）无需特别治疗即可康复。（世界卫生组织）

29.content_english: It is possible to be infected with the virus that causes COVID-19 but not feel any serious symptoms.
29.answer_english: TRUE: Many people will be infected without feeling sick. These people can still be contagious!
29.content_chinese_simplified: 有些人可能已经感染了2019冠状病毒病，但是没有出现任何严重的症状。
29.answer_chinese_simplified: 对：很多无症状感染者不会出现临床症状，但是他们也能成为传染源，具有一定的传播风险。

30.content_english: COVID-19 is more serious than the seasonal flu for multiple reasons. The incubation period is longer, it is new in the population so nobody has developed natural immunity, you are likely to infect more people on average than the flu, and the death rate is significantly higher. (CDC)
30.content_chinese_simplified: 2019冠状病毒病比季节性流感要更为严重，原因包括：1）2019冠状病毒病潜伏期更长；2）2019冠状病毒病是新型病毒，目前没有人对它有免疫力；3）2019冠状病毒病的传染性更强，致死率也比季节性流感要高得多。（美国疾病防控中心）

31.content_english: COVID-19 is very similar to influenza, so it will affect a similar number of people.
31.answer_english: FALSE: Symptoms of COVID-19 are similar to a seasonal flu, but spreads much more rapidly in the population because there is no acquired immunity yet.
31.content_chinese_simplified: 2019冠状病毒病与流感极为相似，所以受其感染的人数也会与流感相当。
31.answer_chinese_simplified: 错：虽然2019冠状病毒病的症状与季节性流感极为相似，但是由于目前人们还未发展出自然免疫力，导致它的传播速度要比流感快得多。

32.content_english: The flu kills thousands of people per year but we don't enforce social distancing for that. Therefore, the extreme measures taken to control COVID-19 are overblown.
32.answer_english: FALSE: In the US, the seasonal flu kills 12 to 61 thousand people per year. As of 4/5/2020, COVID-19 has killed 8500 Americans in less than a month. If this trend continues, the death toll could top 100,000. Right now, social distancing is the only way we can keep more people from losing their lives to COVID-19.
32.content_chinese_simplified: 流感每年也导致几千人丧生，但我们从未因此采取社会隔离措施。由此可见，为了防控2019冠状病毒病而采取极端措施是没有必要的。
32.answer_chinese_simplified: 错：在美国，季节性流感每年导致12,000到61,000人死亡。与之相比，截至2020年4月5日，2019冠状病毒病已在不到一个月的时间内导致8500名美国民众死亡。如果这个趋势继续下去，死亡人数将超过十万人。目前为止，社会隔离是惟一有效的措施阻止病毒快速蔓延，夺走更多人的生命。

33.content_english: Around 1 out of every 6 people who gets COVID-19 becomes seriously ill and develops difficulty breathing. Older people, and those with underlying medical problems like high blood pressure, heart problems or diabetes, are more likely to develop serious illness. People with fever, cough and difficulty breathing should seek medical attention. (WHO)
33.content_chinese_simplified: 大约六分之一的2019冠状病毒病患者会转为重症或危重症，并出现呼吸困难。老年人以及患有基础性疾病（如高血压，心脏病或糖尿病）的人更有可能转为重症。若患者出现发烧，咳嗽和呼吸困难等症状请及时就医。（世界卫生组织）

34.content_english: Studies to date suggest that COVID-19 is mainly transmitted through contact with respiratory droplets rather than through the air.
34.content_chinese_simplified: 迄今的研究结果显示，2019冠状病毒病主要通过呼吸道飞沫传播，而不是通过空气传播。

35.content_english: COVID-19 can be transmitted by infected people with mild or no symptoms, particularly at the early stages of the disease. Asymptomatic transmission makes COVID-19 especially dangerous compared to other infectious diseases. This is why it is critically important to avoid close social contact and maintain good hygiene even if you don’t feel sick. (WHO)
35.content_chinese_simplified: 无症状或轻症患者亦可传播2019冠状病毒病，尤其是在患病早期阶段。无症状传播让2019冠状病毒病比其他传染病更具威胁性和危险性。因此就算您未感到任何不适，自我防护也是极其重要，应避免密切的社会接触，并保持良好的卫生习惯。（世界卫生组织）

36.content_english: If I feel healthy, I can visit my friends without worrying about passing on the disease.
36.answer_english: FALSE: You can be infected with SARS-CoV-2, the virus which causes COVID-19, without feeling sick. You are still contagious in this state. Even if you never develop any symptoms, your body could be harboring the virus. This is one of the most dangerous things about COVID-19.
36.content_chinese_simplified: 如果我健康状况良好，我仍可以走亲访友，无需担心传播病毒。
36.answer_chinese_simplified: 错：无症状传播是2019冠状病毒病最可怕的地方之一。如果您体内携带2019冠状病毒病的致病病毒，SARS-CoV-2，就算您没有表现出任何症状，您的身体仍是滋养病毒的温床，从而成为传播疾病的载体。

37.content_english: The incubation period for COVID-19 ranges from 1 to 14 days, meaning it can take this long to start showing symptoms after initial infection. Some studies have shown that you are the most contagious during the early stages of the disease. This is why social distancing is so important to prevent asymptomatic transmission.
37.content_chinese_simplified: 2019冠状病毒病的潜伏期是1到14天。这意味着从最初感染到症状显现需要1到14天的时间。一些研究表明，在患病初期阶段传染性最大。因此社会隔离措施对防止无症状感染极为重要。

38.content_english: SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted through respiratory droplets, which do not hang in the air for a long time. Therefore, the risk of airborne transmission is low when maintaining at least 6 feet of distance. (WHO)
38.content_chinese_simplified: SAR-CoV-2病毒可以通过呼吸道飞沫传播。飞沫太重，不会长时间悬浮在空气中，因此保持至少六英尺的社交距离可以降低飞沫传播的风险。（世界卫生组织）

39.content_english: If you go to the grocery store, you can reduce the risk of infection by keeping at least 6 feet away from other shoppers.
39.answer_english: TRUE: Airborne transmission is unlikely from more than 6 feet away. However, any closer than that, respiratory droplets can be transmitted by sneezing, coughing, or even just talking. So keep your distance!
39.content_chinese_simplified: 如果您去超市购物，与他人保持至少六英尺的社交距离可以降低受感染的风险。
39.answer_chinese_simplified: 对，该病的致病病毒最有可能传染给与感染者有密切接触（约6 英尺以内）的人。病毒存在于人们咳嗽或打喷嚏、也可能是在说话时喷洒出的飞沫中。彼此保持6英尺的间距有助于保护您不被喷洒的飞沫波及。

40.content_english: Your goal should be to prevent spreading COVID-19 to others, not protecting yourself from infection. Preventative measures will only work if everyone participates!
40.content_chinese_simplified: 您的目标应该是防止将2019冠状病毒病传染给其他人，而不是保护自己。预防措施只有每个人都参与才会有效。

41.content_english: Keep in contact with your friends and relatives via digital communication. Just hanging out at your friend’s place is not social distancing!
41.content_chinese_simplified: 请您通过网络保持跟朋友与家人的联系。在朋友家聚会不是保持社交距离！

42.content_english: Frequently wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after contacting a highly touched surface like a doorknob or elevator button. Hand washing breaks the virus apart when done properly.
42.content_chinese_simplified: 经常用肥皂和水洗手至少要洗20秒，尤其是触摸了高度接触的表面，比如门把手或电梯按钮。正确地洗手会让病毒分解。

43.content_english: Hand washing breaks down the virus more effectively than hand sanitizer.
43.answer_english: TRUE: Soap and water obliterate virus particles. Soap actually pulls apart the virus's structure, and water washes it away. Hand sanitizer will also help, but is not as thorough as hand washing,
43.content_chinese_simplified: 洗手会比洗手液更有效地分解病毒。
43.answer_chinese_simplified: 对，肥皂和水可以分解病毒颗粒。肥皂可以破坏病毒外膜，水可以把分解的病毒冲走。洗手液也有一定的效果，可是洗手更有效。

44.content_english: Avoid touching your face with unwashed hands.
44.content_chinese_simplified: 避免用没有洗过的手触摸面部

45.content_english: Use alcohol based hand sanitizer if you are unable to wash your hands. You should sanitize before and after visiting a public place like a grocery store. (WHO)
45.content_chinese_simplified: 如果您无法用肥皂与水洗手，可以使用酒精类的洗手液。在您去公共场合（比如超市）之前和之后，都请消毒。（世界卫生组织）

46.content_english: Sneeze into your elbow instead of your hand. This prevents spreading respiratory droplets to places where others can contact them. (WHO)
46.content_chinese_simplified: 打喷嚏时，请用弯曲的肘部而不是手来遮挡口鼻。这样会防止呼吸道里的飞沫散布到其他人可以触摸的地方。（世界卫生组织）

47.content_english: Stay home if you feel sick! If you are experiencing symptoms of COVID-19, call a healthcare professional before physically visiting a clinic. Your local health authority can provide more up to date information about COVID-19 testing and treatment in your area. You are more likely to contract COVID-19 at a clinic, as cases are increasing and staff are becoming more and more overwhelmed. (WHO)
47.content_chinese_simplified: 如果您觉得自己生病了，请待在家里！如果您有2019冠状病毒病的症状，请在前往诊所之前致电医疗救护人员。您当地的卫生局可以提供更多有关您所在地区2019冠状病毒病检测与治疗的最新信息。随着病例的增加和工作人员的不堪重负，您更有可能在诊所感染病毒。 （世界卫生组织）
